Acting as a prequel to the great Amazon Prime show, its first episode debuts today on the Epic Games Store, with its remaining four episodes dropping every two weeks after that. That means all episodes should be available to binge on September 21st.
Read more
articles.title: Telltale Games return with The Expanse's first episode, out today

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
The Sims has gone unchallenged in the life simulation genre for a quarter century and the wait for a challenger is about to get a few months longer. Developers Paradox Tectonic have pushed back the early access launch for their human dollhouse rival Life By You to March 5th 2024. Rod Humble, the studio’s general manager and former Sims boss, said the game will be “a more robust experience out the gate” thanks to the six-month delay.
Read more
articles.title: Life By You early access launch delayed until March 2024

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Humble Bundle’s latest collection of good games for a good price and a good cause is a whopping instant library of classic Dungeons & Dragons CRPGs, including both original Baldur’s Gate games, some similarly legendary classics and some more modern additions to the genre. It’s quite the deal.

 
Read more
articles.title: Baldur’s Gate Humble Bundle parties up both Enhanced Editions, plus even more D&D CRPG classics, for a song

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
World of Warcraft has launched a new pack of companion pets that will donate all of its proceeds towards helping those in Ukraine. The Pet Pack for Ukraine will benefit BlueCheck, an organisation that works to support a variety of NGOs in the war-struck country offering everything from vital medical supplies and power generators to humanitarian aid.

 
Read more
articles.title: World of Warcraft looks to support Ukraine with charitable pet pack and the help of Mila Kunis

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Realms of Ruin, the first RTS set in the world of Warhammer: Age of Sigmar - that’s the shiny fantasy sibling to Warhammer 40k’s gritty sci-fi universe - will see a host of improvements and fixes in the wake of its recent open beta, developers Frontier have promised. Among the biggest incoming changes are better balancing, UI polish and a fix to its most annoying issue of accidental retreats caused by shared key bindings.

 
Read more
articles.title: Warhammer RTS Realms of Ruin promises improvements to unit balance, AI difficulty, controls and UI after “loud and clear” open beta feedback

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The Cosmic Wheel Sisterhood is the next game from Deconstructeam, the folks behind gorgeous and pensive cyberpunk bartending game The Red Strings Club. Like that game, it looks to be a beautifully pixelly exploration of fate, wrapped up in the clicky satisfaction of a branching story game. After Rachel was left impressed by its mixture of the mystical and magical earlier this year, we’ll all be able to play it next month.

 
Read more
articles.title: Red Strings Club devs’ mystical branching-narrative game Cosmic Wheel Sisterhood foresees a release date next month

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Ideally, the story of Remnant II’s launch would start and end with it being an ambitious success of a shooty Soulslike. Sadly not: in a Reddit post addressing complaints of wonky performance, even on higher-end graphics cards, developers Gunfire Games admitted to having "designed the game with upscaling in mind." 
Working the likes of Nvidia DLSS, AMD FSR, and Intel XeSS into a game wouldn’t normally be a cause of incredulity. Indeed, as optional performance boosters, they’re pretty much always a welcome sight amid the duller texture filtering and ambient occlusion toggles of the average settings menu. The problem here is that with its dismal performance at native, non-upscaled resolutions, Remnant II essentially forgets about the 'optional' part – and in doing so, undermines what makes DLSS and its rivals such valuable tools in the first place.
Read more
articles.title: Remnant II might be designed around upscalers, but DLSS isn't a band aid for bad performance

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Under the new rights holders Studio 2.21, cult classic series Little Big Adventure was set to make a comeback after three decades off-grid, with original creator Didier Chanfray attached to the projects. The comeback plans included an all-new reboot, plus remasters for the two 1990s action-adventure games. But today, the studio announced that they were “unsuccessful in securing a publisher,” which has led to the reboot’s cancellation and layoffs at the developer.


“Despite our earnest efforts,” CEO Ben Limare wrote in a blog post, “we were unsuccessful in securing a publisher for the reboot of Twinsen’s Little Big Adventure.” According to Limare, the reasons for this are threefold: genre appeal, the series’ limited recognition, and the planned costs. “Despite a passionate, albeit small, community of fans, Twinsen’s Little Big Adventure isn’t globally recognized, which added to the hesitations of potential publishers,” wrote Limare.


“While indie game studios can often deliver remarkable games with lean teams (as we've seen with Death’s Door and Tunic), our vision for this project involved a team of 15 to 20 people, echoing the original game's size,” he continued. “This considerable investment, juxtaposed with the risk inherent to the genre and IP, was a factor in the decision.”
 
Read more
articles.title: Twinsen's Little Big Adventure reboot cancelled as studio were "unsuccessful in securing a publisher"

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
In writing about games like A Little To The Left or current RPS Game Club pick Unpacking, I often have to point out that I am a weird little gremlin who loves puzzles and putting things in the right place in games, but not actually in real life. In real life, I write to you today from a desk covered in a weird detritus of work and life that wouldn't quite see me on an exploitative reality TV show with the word hoarder somewhere in the title, but, you know... maybe give it 15 years.
But I bloody love tidying things in games. Getting everything in the right place. And something that makes it extra enjoyable in Unpacking is the sound design. The house itself is quiet, but everything in the game makes a little noise when you put it away or hang it up or slide it in a shelf, and it's all stuff you recognise from home. It makes the whole experience feel domestic and familiar.
Read more
articles.title: The little noises in Unpacking help make it a life you can understand

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
I’m guessing there’s an unwritten and unbreakable commandment that states every 2023 game must release next month. As evidence, the action RPG slasher Wayfinder is entering early access on August 15th. The game has some faint MMO flavours and comes from developers Airship Syndicate (the studio behind Darksiders: Genesis and Battle Chaser: Nightwar) and publisher Digital Extremes (responsible for the long-running Warframe.) The game previously held various closed playtests, but now the metaphorical doors are being opened for more players.

 
Read more
articles.title: Online action RPG Wayfinder enters early access on August 15th

articles.author: Rebecca Jones
articles.description:
We begin this episode with a little bit of sad news: the Indiescovery podcast is going on hiatus, due to the fact that Rachel and I are both leaving Rock Paper Shotgun for pastures new. However, there's no need to be too downhearted, as your favourite indie-loving trio has every intention of continuing to collaborate on a few silly bits and bobs here and there.
Listen on RSS feed, Spotify, Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, Pocket Casts, Amazon Music, TuneIn, Deezer, YouTube, or — if you prefer — right here:
 Read more
articles.title: Indiescovery Episode 15: Goodbye (For Now)

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Following the fast and psychedelic fingertip shooting of Into The Pit, developer Nullpointer Games are now slowing things down with their next project. The team shook together turn-based tactics, tower-defence elements, and a graphic novel style, and the resulting cocktail is Void Warden. See how it sort of works in the teaser below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Void Warden is a strategy-tower-defence hybrid from the developer behind Into The Pit

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Now that Diablo 4's new season has arrived, I thought I'd give the game another shot. So, in an evening spare of stuff to do, I booted the game up and created a druid called ANIMALS. After a few hours of pressing 1,3,2,4, in either the same pattern or different patterns, I've come to realise the game doesn't make me feel anything. I bash some skeletons, I equip a staff, I exit to Windows, I couldn't care less. Maybe, though, it's not such a bad thing?
I know I said I'd like Diablo 4 to channel Vampire Survivors and give me an auto-attack switch, so I could just steer my character through encounters without having to think at all. I still stand by my stubbornness! But having obliterated more packs of rabid wolves and legions of demons, I've come to develop what I think is ARPG muscle memory.
Read more
articles.title: I play Diablo 4 and I feel nothing. I think this is good?

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
CD Projekt Red have announced another batch of layoffs, this time affecting “around 100” employees, or roughly 9% of the company’s total headcount. The redundancies won’t take place immediately, according to CDPR, as some employees won’t lose their jobs until early next year at the latest.


“There’s no easy way to say this, but today we are overstaffed,” said CEO Adam Kiciński in an ‘organisational update’ posted to the company’s website. “We have talented people on board who are finishing their tasks and — based on current and expected project needs — we already know we don’t have other opportunities for them in the next year,” he continued. 


“To meet our own high expectations and ambitions to create the best role-playing games, we not only want to have the best people but also the right teams,” says Kiciński. “What we mean by that is having teams that are built around our projects’ needs; teams that are more agile and more effective… After reshaping our development process and incorporating Agile methodologies, we’re now focusing on refining the shape of our teams.” Those projects in question include another Witcher trilogy, a Cyberpunk 2077 sequel, and an all-new IP codenamed Project Hadar. That’s in addition to the upcoming Cyberpunk 2077 expansion called Phantom Liberty.  
 
Read more
articles.title: CD Projekt Red announce another batch of layoffs affecting around 100 employees

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
After a year in early access, developer Afterschool Studio have announced that Cantata is fully launching on August 15th. Cantata is a turn-based strategy game with some production chain management thrown in for good measure, alongside the massive maps and base building. Take a look at the candy-coloured Dune-esque world below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Colourful strategy game Cantata leaves early access on August 15th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Arma 3's latest Creator DLC is out now. Called Spearhead 1944, it takes the realistic military simulator to World War 2 for a co-op campaign featuring over 90 period-accurate weapons and vehicles, as well as singleplayer and multiplayer scenarios.

The launch trailer below, and it looks great.

 
Read more
articles.title: Arma 3's World War 2 DLC Spearhead 1944 is out now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Ubisoft have apparently aborted plans for a sequel to Immortals Fenyx Rising, according to a report on VGC. They cite "multiple development sources" who, speaking anonymously, say that the project was scrapped earlier this month.

 
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft have reportedly scrapped an Immortals Fenyx Rising sequel

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Gallium Nitride (GaN) chargers are pretty awesome, as they're much smaller than traditional power bricks allowing for some pretty bonkers specs in a tiny space. That's certainly the case for this Tecknet GaN triple charger, which offers two USB-C ports, one USB-A port and up to 65W of charging for Steam Deck, ROG Ally, laptops, tablets and phones. 
It normally retails for £33, but today it's available for £25 - an awesome price for this spec.  
Read more
articles.title: £25 for a powerful 65W three-port GaN USB-C charger is a great deal

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB) have proposed a new method for guaranteeing parental consent to help protect children's privacy online. The method involves "Privacy-Protective Facial Age Estimation" technology, which would scan an adult's face to confirm their age before they're able to consent on behalf a child.

 
Read more
articles.title: The FTC wants to know whether you think "facial age estimation" technology is a good idea

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Baldur's Gate and Baldur's Gate 2 are two of the finest CRPGs ever devised, with incredible stories, characters and settings, and now you can relive one of the highlights of my childhood for just £2.99. That's a 90% savings on the two Enhanced Editions of the game, which run out of the box on modern PCs and even Steam Deck.  
Read more
articles.title: Baldur's Gate 1 and 2 are down to £3 at Fanatical

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The 30 minute demonstration back in June communicated the scope of Bethesda's spacefaring RPG, Starfield. If what you want is more flavour, tone, some player motivation, then three new animated shorts released today might help. Each tells a short 2-3 minute story of a different character in Starfield's galaxy, as they attempt to resolve their deep yearning with spaceships. To which we can all relate.

 
Read more
articles.title: Starfield's animated trailers offer some player motivation for life among the stars

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
You know how some games are notebook games? Well, The Banished Vault is a manual game, no two ways about it. Sure, you could theoretically make meticulous notes about all the planetary symbols and construction costs of the various buildings you'll need to harvest and convert resources into fuel, alloys and elixirs as you hurtle through space trying to escape the terrifying Gloom based on its in-game manual. But when there's a physical paper booklet that replicates all that for you in a much more easily accessible format, with several gorgeous illustrations of its mysterious space monastery to boot, not to mention infinitely better explanations of what everything does than I could ever hope to describe, it's quickly become an essential part of my play experience. 
I'm still working on my review for The Banished Vault (hopefully coming later this week), but as it launches on Steam today, I'd strongly recommend spending the extra £5/$5 to get one if you're at all interested in Lunar Division's space survival management 'em up. I don't think I could have survived in the game without it.
Read more
articles.title: I don't think I could survive The Banished Vault's space management without its physical manual

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Thief-but-with-guns game Gloomwood continues its early access crawl with today’s update, adding a delightful market district to the game. You can get your hair cut, buy a new outfit or two, and generally have a nice time. There definitely won’t be any murder or dangerous reasons to skulk through the shadows. And that dog? He doesn't bite, honest. Take a look at the bustling shopping centre below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Spooky stealth 'em up Gloomwood adds bustling market district in latest update

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Welcome to the 2023 edition of The RPS 100, our annual celebration of our favourite PC games of all time. Like previous years, this isn't a list of the definitive best PC games of all time, nor is it about what's considered the most important or influential. Rather, this is a ranking that reflects who we are as a team - our own personal Bestest Bests, so to speak, and the games that are nearest and dearest to our collective hivemind hearts. Once again, we're splitting the list in two articles this year, so come on in and find out what's made the cut in Part One below. 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS 100 (2023): our top PC games of all time (100-51)

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Recently I sat down with GGRecon for a roundtable-ish interview with Armored Core 6: Fires Of Rubicon director Masaru Yamamura and producer Yasunori Ogura to talk more about their upcoming mecha action game. And their answers gave us more of an insight into the game's early development, where the story might take you, and how you might overcome some of its trickiest nuts and bolts.
While it won't come as much of a surprise to Armored Core veterans, Armored Core 6 isn't an open world game. If you're a new FromSoftware-liker brought on board by the expansive world of Elden Ring, then yes, you might be a bit surprised. As I mention in my preview, Armored Core 6 sees you play a mecha-mercenary who selects jobs from a drop down menu and jets off to destroy whatever needs destroying. But Yamamura says FromSoft actually considered going down a more open world route in early stages of the game's development.
Read more
articles.title: Armored Core 6 actually considered "a more open world route"

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
With a trusty can of Red Bull coursing through my veins and my heart rate pounding like a jackhammer, I spent around three hours with Armored Core 6: Fires Of Rubicon's first chapter. And rather like Red Bull's metallic fizz of aspartame and rocket fuel, I'd say the game shares a similar makeup. It doesn't give you wings, but what it does give you is a mech as nimble as a Eurasian Blue Tit darting at a confetti of stale bread.
As a historic mech-disliker, the game actually managed to instil a desire to become a skilled mech pilot. I want to buy new metal legs and attach gatling guns to my spine! But I'm apprehensive about the grind to get those parts and whether some of AC6's Souls influences clash with its rapid pace.
Read more
articles.title: Armored Core 6 will make you feel like a ten-tonne figure skater

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Remedy Entertainment, the studio behind several wonderfully odd shooters, have a fun trend where they put writer turned creative director Sam Lake on-screen in many of their projects. He’s playing an FBI agent in the upcoming Alan Wake 2, but the trend started with the studio’s breakout hit Max Payne, where the titular tortured man’s face was modelled after Lake’s. One new mod now brings back his grimacing face in the bullet time threequel Max Payne 3. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Miss Max Payne's original face? This mod puts Sam Lake's mug in Max Payne 3

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
While I was on holiday last week I started playing Alan Wake for the first time ever in my whole life, due to a working theory that I might end up reviewing the sequel one day, who knows. I am furious because none of you told me Alan Wake is essentially Garth Marenghi in his Twin Peaks era, and if you had I would have played it ages ago. The game is such a knowing snake ball of mating tropes that it ouroboroses round into being brilliant, flawless, ridiculous. And also Alan is a terrible writer, I would hate his books. But also everyone should leave him alone because he's doing his best. 
Read more
articles.title: Alan Wake is a terrible writer but dammit, I respect him

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Sega and Humankind developers Amplitude have begun their annual seasonal celebration Endless Summer to celebrate everything related to their loosely-connected Endless universe. From now until July 27th, there will be streams and news drops about their forthcoming tactical roguelite Endless Dungeon, and as a bonus, its excellent sort-of-predecessor Dungeon Of The Endless is free to keep on Steam for a limited time. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Humankind devs' hit roguelike Dungeon Of The Endless is free to keep on Steam

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Another day, another Eastern MMO picked up by Amazon Games and repackaged for a Western audience. What's the grind this time? Blue Protocol, an anime MMO developed by Bandai Namco that's already out in Japan, and is due out in the West sometime in 2024. I played it for an hour and I've come away thinking it's a slick operation, with some slight Monster Hunter edge to its combat. While the future sounds promising, questions remain around a world which seems a bit eh, and the ever looming march of the microtransactions.
Read more
articles.title: Blue Protocol seems like a slick anime MMO, if an extremely predictable one

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
One eagle-eyed Starfield fan has apparently spent around 200 hours stitching together what could be the game’s entire skill tree using previously released footage of Bethesda's epic space RPG. I’m not actually sure whether you can be a “Starfield fan” before the game releases, but this budding detective is at least a fan of the trailers, featurettes, and the Starfield Direct. Come and see what they've come up with.
Read more
articles.title: Starfield's entire skill tree supposedly laid bare after someone spent 200 hours stitching together trailer footage

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Hello folks. You may have noticed that our game tag pages have had a bit of a face-lift recently. Previously, these pages were quite plain lists of everything we'd written about the game in question, but thanks to your feedback and some fancy design work from our tech team, these pages are now (hopefully) a lot more useful and better-looking. Here's what's changed.
Read more
articles.title: Our game tag pages have changed, here's what's new

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Publisher THQ Nordic have announced that Trine 5: A Clockwork Conspiracy is coming out in the middle of a big game tempest on August 31st. The co-op puzzle game promises to be the longest and most challenging entry in the series' history and reunites our three lovable heroes: Zoya the thief, Amadeus the wizard, and Pontius the knight. Developers Frozenbyte marked the news with a character trailer, reintroducing the famous knight and his refreshed abilities. (Re)connect with Pontius below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Co-op puzzler Trine 5: A Clockwork Conspiracy comes out on August 31st

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
As a republican it pains me to suggest you install a castle and a royal family as soon as possible, because they're very useful, but in fariness to me that suggestion is only in the specific circumstance that you're playing Lakeburg Legacies. It's an almost experimental little town management game where you have no control over building placement, your citizens all look like they were made in Picrew, and love is a plentiful yet almost useless resource. I quite like it, but I wish I liked it more.
Read more
articles.title: Lakeburg Legacies review: what's love got to do with town management?

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
What's the cheapest graphics card that includes a free copy of Starfield? That would be this AsRock RX 6600 8GB, available for just £186 shipped on Overclockers. This card is an ideal choice for 1080p gaming and has dropped in price consistently over the last few months, making it an even better value than it was in 2022. 
Read more
articles.title: The cheapest AMD GPU to come with a free copy of Starfield is this £186 RX 6600

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Samsung's 990 Pro 2TB SSD is the fastest gaming SSD on the market in terms of real-world performance - no wonder it's one of our top picks for gaming SSDs. Today you can pick up one of these 7300MB/s PCIe 4.0 NVMe drives for £133, down from its regular price of £170. 
Read more
articles.title: Get the fastest 2TB SSD we've ever tested for £133

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Invincible, the comic book-turned-animated TV series from Walking Dead co-creator Robert Kirkman, is being turned into a fully-fledged visual novel. Attached to Invincible Presents: Atom Eve are Shadow of the Tomb Raider, Mothergunship and Assassin’s Creed devs, who will centre the single-player game around the superhero from the original series.

 
Read more
articles.title: Comic-turned-TV show Invincible’s first PC game will be ‘visual novel RPG’ Atom Eve

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Steam has snuck out its latest week-long sales event. This time, it’s a celebration of all things silent and potentially deadly worth making some noise about in the Steam Stealth Fest. Among the highlights are some pretty steep savings on Hitman, Assassin’s Creed, A Plague Tale and Sniper Elite, along with some indie stealth game gems to boot.

 
Read more
articles.title: Steam’s Stealth Fest sneaks out a bunch of demos and deals, including half-price Hitman, Assassin’s Creed savings and much more

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy 14 has dozens of mounts, ranging from familiar Final Fantasy chocobos and monsters to some incredible elemental horses, birds and robots. Then there’s the even wilder rides available, from space whales, sentient vegetables and flying beds to witches’ brooms, ghosts and a literal disembodied head. Even so, its latest mount might somehow be one of its best yet.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 14’s new motorcycle mount has its adorable chocobo ride shotgun

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Mortal Kombat 1 is lining up quite the star-studded kast for its DLC, with JK Simmons set to reprise his role as Omni-Man from animated series Invincible. Simmons’ on-screen depiction of the komic-book kharacter joins John Cena’s DC Komics anti-hero Peacemaker and Antony Starr as The Boys’ Homelander, alongside some returning Mortal Kombat faces, in the fighting game’s komic-heavy Kombat Pack. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Mortal Kombat 1 adds Invincible’s Omni-Man - and JK Simmons - to its roster of DLC komic-book kharacters

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ukážeme si užitečný balíček, který v kooperaci s překladačem a linkerem jazyka Go umožňuje vkládat data do výsledného spustitelného souboru. To zjednodušuje nasazení aplikace a zmenšuje míru „instalačních“ chyb.
articles.title: Vkládání dat přímo do spustitelných souborů vytvářených překladačem jazyka Go

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: V chladném Norsku bylo někomu pěkně horko, v USA mají novou kyberpečeť, ve Velké Británii možná nebudou mít Facetime a na Havaji to měli drahé. AMD má svůj „bleed“, Microsoft dohání Google a VirusTotal se omlouvá.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: hlídač s dírou ve vlastním plotě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Debian GNU/Linux oficiálně podporuje open-source architekturu RISC-V. Ubuntu 23.10 „Mantic Minotaur“ bude mít linuxové jádro 6.5. Nadace UBports Foundation oznámila vydání Ubuntu Touch OTA-2.
articles.title: Debian vyjde pro RISC-V, Ubuntu 23.10 na­bídne jádro 6.5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Toto literární dílo je věnováno drsným hackerům Divokého Východu, kteří mstili nestabilitu a oslavovali Výkon: ať byl použit na cokoli.
articles.title: Linuxový Joe: 1. díl

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: GNU Assembler se připravuje na příští generace CPU Intel, Týden v KDE opět ve znamení Plasmy 6, FreeBSD pracuje na podpoře LinuxBootu.
articles.title: FreeBSD s podporou až 1024 CPU jader, rychlejší start Cyberpunku 2077 s GPU Intel

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ovladač pro správu BIOSu na počítačích HP, vstupní ovladač pro nositelnou elektroniku, Dynamic Boost Control pro AMD, firmware pro Radeony RX 7700/7800 v AMDGPU, patche pro Radeony příští generace.
articles.title: Novinky nejen pro Linux 6.6: spousta kódu pro Radeony, ovládání pro BIOSy u HP

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Python je multiparadigmatickým jazykem, což znamená, že lze psát prakticky čistě imperativně, ale i objektově. Navíc v Pythonu nalezneme poměrně velké množství vlastností převzatých z funkcionálních jazyků.
articles.title: Podpora funkcionálního programování v Pythonu a knihovna functools

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Dnes si představíme prohlížeč vícerozměrných obrázků, budeme spravovat úkoly pomocí kanbanové tabule, vyzkoušíme nástroj pro měření rychlosti přenosu dat a nakonec zkombinujeme poznámky s kalkulátorem.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (26. 7. 2023): správa úkolů na kanbanové tabuli

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V prakticky každé hře se setkáme s pohybujícími se objekty. Vykreslování takových objektů na ZX Spectru je poměrně složité kvůli specifické organizaci grafické paměti a systému barvových atributů.
articles.title: Vykreslování spritů a animací na ZX Spectru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Ubuntu 23.10 jako výchozí font nasadí Noto místo stávajícího DejaVu. Dusk OS je svobodný operační systém, který počítá s kolapsem civilizace. Po 30 letech aktivity zůstává Slackware nejstarší stále fungující linuxovou distribucí.
articles.title: Ubuntu bude mít nový font, Slackware oslavil 30. narozeniny

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Včera byl vydán MX-23, nejnovější verze MX Linuxu stavějící na Debianu 12 se sysVinit jako výchozím (systemd je k dispozici též) a dalšími aktualizacemi všemožných nástrojů z vlastní dílny. Distribuce nabízí novější verze desktopových prostředí a rozhraní jako Xfce 4.18, Fluxbox 1.3.7 a KDE Plasma 5.27.
articles.title: MX Linux 23 staví na Debianu 12

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Pojďme vypnout ten stupidní AMD fTPM generátor, hřímá v těchto dnech Linus Torvalds. Generátor náhodných čísel implementovaný u Ryzenů (atd.) ve fTPM části je chybový a bude lepší se jeho používání vyhnout tak, že jej [na Linuxu] prostě nebudeme používat.
articles.title: Linus Torvalds chce vypnout generátor náhodných čísel z AMD fTPM

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Mozilla vydala „stošestnáctý“ Firefox s několika příjemnými novinkami. Předně ti, kdo mají v oblibě pouštění videí v PiP okénku mohou přímo v něm měnit hlasitost pomocí posuvníku, zde Mozilla sama říká, že vyslyšela volání komunity.
articles.title: Firefox 116 a nastavení hlasitosti u videa v Picture-in-Picture, úprava Ctrl+Shift+T

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V půlce června vyšel hodně přepracovaný Thunderbird verze 115 a ne všechny slibované funkce se do něj stihly dostat. Chybí například plánovaná synchronizace, o jejíž absenci píše také český server Mozilla.cz. Vývojáři slibují, že synchronizace se dostane do příštího velkého vydání a v betě bychom se jí měli dočkat na přelomu letošního a příštího roku.
articles.title: Thunderbird se synchronizace dočká příští rok, vrátí se i Firefox Send

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Twitter nedávno změnil logo i název na X. Problém nastal v Apple App Store pro iOS, kde aplikace musí mít název minimálně ze dvou písmen.
articles.title: Twitter se nemohl v App Store přejmenovat na X, ale již je vše v pořádku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Debian nedávno oznámil novou 64bitovou architekturu RISC-V (riscv64), která bude dostupná od Debianu 13 Trixie. Ten vyjde asi za dva roky, nicméně Debian již chystá infrastrukturu pro nativní kompilování balíčků. V současnosti používá devět SiFive HiFive Unmatched, což je v současnosti asi nejvýkonnější RISC-V, který zároveň běží na standardním jádře.
articles.title: Debian pro RISC-V používá devět SiFive HiFive Unmatched

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Léto je nyní sice poněkud chladné, ale na Virtuální Bastlírně se jako každý měsíc dozvíte od strahovských bastlířů žhavé novinky. Mimo jiné se dozvíte, že do výroby by se po mnoha peripetiích měl dostat úsporný slovenský procesor s až 128 jádry, byl spuštěn online výukový editor pro Raspberry Pi a objevil se nový levný RISC-V procesor s USB-PD.
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 29: Dálkové ovládání bez baterií?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: LPython je nový open-source překladač Pythonu do optimalizovaného kódu. Podporovaný back-end je LLVM, C, C++, WASM, Julia a x86. LPython by měl být kompatibilní se standardním CPythonem a podporuje také JIT (just-in-time) kompilaci.
articles.title: Rychlý překladač Pythonu LPython

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Máte spravovat síťové prvky společnosti MikroTik, ale chybí vám potřebné znalosti a zkušenosti? Přijďte na naše školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a kromě všech důležitých informací si domů odnesete i vlastní router MikroTik.
articles.title: Přijďte na školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a odnesete si router

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Intel nedávno zveřejnil APX (Advanced Performance Extension). Spolu s APX budou mít budoucí procesory také AVX10 (Advanced Vector Extension 10). AVX10 bude zahrnovat ne příliš oblíbené AVX512 a zároveň bude možné AVX10 instrukce pouštět jak na výkonných P-jádrech, tak na úsporných E-jádrech.
articles.title: Intel představil AVX10 jako lepší AVX512 i pro E-jádra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Rychlý linker mold vyšel ve středu ve verzi 2.0. Jeho vývojář Rui Ueyama ze Singapuru si před časem stěžoval, že mu vývoj mold nepřináší zisk a zvažoval změnu licence. Ta je změněna právě ve verzi 2.0 a jde o licenci MIT místo předchozí AGPL. Autor si od změny licence slibuje větší uživatelskou základnu.
articles.title: Rychlý linker mold 2.0 má novou licenci MIT

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Apple AirTag je malé sledovací zařízení používající Bluetooth a také nový UWB (ultra-wideband). Primárně je určeno k nalezení například klíčů, může však být zneužito ke sledování lidí.
articles.title: Android dostane varování před sledováním pomocí AirTagu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Na internetu píšou, že začít s automatizací správy serverů můžete do půl hodiny. Dokážeme vám, že s Ansible to je pravda. Stačí navštívit naše pražské školení Ansible – úvod do automatizace a pak navazující Ansible – role a AWX.
articles.title: Ansible: úvod do automatizace, role a AWX (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Státní tajemník v Úřadu vlády České republiky vyhlásil výběrové řízení na obsazení pozice v Oddělení systémové podpory v Úřadu vlády ČR. Jde o služební poměr s nástupem od 1. září 2023. Požadavek je bakalářské či magisterské vzdělání, prověření na stupeň „tajné“ (možno doplnit). Vybraný IT expert bude mít k dispozici 5 týdnů dovolené a 5 sick days (plus 5 dnů studijního volna), musí počítat s pružnou pracovní dobou atd.
articles.title: Úřad vlády ČR shání IT specialistu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nedávno převzal Canonical údržbu projektu LXD. Nyní dnes již bývalí správci projektu hlásí, že přišli o oprávnění a projekt nově mohou spravovat pouze zaměstnanci Canonicalu. Alespoň tolik vyplývá ze zprávy, kterou zveřejnil vývojář a (dnes již bývalý) správce LXC/LXD a současně dřívější zaměstnanec Canonicalu Christian Brauner na Mastodontu.
articles.title: Canonical utahuje šrouby kolem LXD, správci musí být z Canonicalu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V jádru distribuce Ubuntu se nacházejí dvě chyby označené CVE-2023–2640 a CVE-2023–32629, a to v modulu OverlayFS.Dle výzkumníku z Wiz Research, kteří tyto chyby umožňující eskalaci oprávnění nalezli, postihují zhruba 40 % uživatelů této distribuce. Poukazují současně na to, že postižené verze Ubuntu jsou nezřídka používány v cloudových službách.
articles.title: Ubuntu má dvě zranitelnosti v OverlayFS umožňující navýšení práv uživatele, oprava je k dispozici

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Český LibreOffice tým vydává aktualizaci překladu příručky LibreOffice Draw 7.4. Tato kniha se zabývá hlavními funkcemi programu Draw, vektorové grafické komponenty systému LibreOffice.
articles.title: Český překlad příručky LibreOffice Draw 7.4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Android verze 4.4 nesl název KitKat a kdysi byl velmi populární. I takto starý systém je možné ještě provozovat, protože se v něm automaticky aktualizuje Google Play a s ním také Služby Google včetně moderních API. Google ovšem nyní ohlásil, že už takto starý operační systém nebude podporovat a novější Google Play na něm už nepoběží.
articles.title: Google Play končí s podporou deset let starého Androidu 4.4 KitKat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: cc)
articles.description: APX je nové rozšíření 64bitové architektury x86, které rozšiřuje množství základních registrů z 16 na 32. Aby bylo možné tyto registry adresovat, vznikl nový prefix REX2 pro základní instrukční sadu a možnost použít prefix EVEX u novějších instrukcí, které používají prefix VEX.
articles.title: Intel zveřejnil rozšíření APX: Advanced Performance Extension

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Prometheus je moderní monitoringový nástroj a metrics server. Umožňuje sbírat metrická data z vaší aplikace a většiny komponent vaší infrastruktury a nad těmito daty dělat grafy (v Grafaně) a vytvářet varování. Prometheus spadá pod CNCF, stejně jako Kubernetes. Pokud chcete podrobně sledovat stav infrastruktury a služeb, zúčastněte se našeho dvoudenního školení Prometheus.
articles.title: Prometheus: moderní monitoringový nástroj a sběrač metrik (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Přehrávač MPV 0.36 stavějící na projektech MPlayer a MPlayer2 v kombinaci s balíkem ffmpeg nabízí v nové verzi podporu neceločíselného škálování na Waylandu, tedy protokolu wp-fractional-scale-v1. Na Waylandu také už funguje OSD při použití DMA-BUF výstupu, vylepšeno je nakládání s chybami na Waylandu, opraven memory leak s více monitory a přibyla i podpora panscan/panningu s DMA-BUF na Waylandu.
articles.title: MPV Player 0.36 přidává Wayland Fractional Scaling a dekódování pomocí Vulkan Video

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Katalogové zóny v DNS umožňují synchronizovat množinu nakonfigurovaných zón napříč autoritativními servery. Konfigurace serveru je serializována do běžného formátu zóny a k její úplné (AXFR) nebo inkrementální (IXFR) synchronizaci jsou použity zavedené rutiny zónového transferu. Obsah katalogové zóny by měl být neveřejný a sdílený jen mezi autoritativními servery.
articles.title: Katalogové zóny v DNS standardizovány jako RFC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Operačnímu systému OpenBSD až dosud chyběla jedna podstatná funkcionalita, a sice podpora aktualizací mikrokódu CPU AMD. Nyní ve větvi current již je implementována.
articles.title: OpenBSD dostalo podporu aktualizace mikrokódu CPU AMD

articles.author: bkralik
articles.description:
Léto je nyní sice poněkud chladné, ale na Virtuální Bastlírně se jako každý měsíc dozvíte od strahovských bastlířů žhavé novinky! Mimo jiné se dozvíte, že do výroby by se po mnoha peripetiích měl dostat úsporný slovenský procesor s až 128 jádry, byl spuštěn online výukový editor pro Raspberry Pi a objevil se nový levný RISC-V procesor s USB-PD. Ze světa softwaru určitě stojí za zmínku jednoduchý dekodér NOAA map o počasí, CircuitPython na procesorech od SiLabs nebo asistenta řízení pro většinu aut pomocí AI OpenPilot.

Nejvíce témat však mají, jak je zvykem, ze světa hadwaru - uvidíte PCI-E karty s atomovými hodinami, které byly k vidění na summitu v Praze, identifikátor chemických látek na bázi Ramanova rozptylu, rozpustné ekologické DPS nebo open source PLC.

Z podivností tentokrát vybrali návrh a simulaci cívek v Blenderu, kterak jsou IMAX kina ovládána emulovaným PDA Palm nebo jak fungovala bezbateriová dálková ovládání k televizi v 50. letech, kdy o power harvestingu ještě nemohla být ani řeč.

Ať už vás zaujalo cokoliv z nabízených témat nebo chcete ukázat nějaký svůj bastl, dorazte! Příští Virtuální Bastlírna se pod taktovkou projektu MacGyver studentského klubu SiliconHill bude konat v úterý 1. srpna od 20:00 minimálně do 22:00 (ale obvykle končí o dost později). Odkaz na konferenci se před samotnou akcí objeví na bastlířské wiki.
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 29: Dálkové ovládání bez baterií?

With Bergamo the flagship AMD EPYC 9754 provides 128 cores with SMT and the Zen 4C cores still boast AVX-512. Another nifty aspect on this high core count CPU catering to cloud service providers is the adjustable TDP from 320 to Watts. Prior Phoronix benchmarks have looked at the default 360 Watt performance and the 400W at the high-end with power determinism mode while today's article is looking at the efficiency gains made possible by pulling back to a 320W cTDP.

articles.description: While this week was the surprise announcement of Intel AVX10 and with that taking the super-set of AVX-512 to both E and P core processors in the future, for next year's Xeon "Sierra Forest" server processors at up to 144 cores, it appears they will lack AVX-512/AVX10. Intel's AVX10 announcement noted initial support with Granite Rapids processors that will debut next year but no mention of the E-core-only Sierra Forest. With the AVX10 only coming to P/E core client processors after Granite Rapids, it would appear the high density Sierra Forest generation will miss out on AVX10/AVX-512 and not appear until Clearwater Forest. Meanwhile with the 128-core AMD EPYC "Bergamo" processors now shipping, there is AVX-512 with the Zen 4C cores. Here are some benchmarks looking at the AVX-512 impact for Bergamo.
articles.title: The AVX-512 Performance Advantage With AMD EPYC Bergamo

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
Developer Pat Naoum has just launched The Master's Pupil, a game that's the culmination of seven years of hand-painted work.
If there's any doubt, Pat explains that he didn't merely use his hands to pick up an electronic stylus to draw the game on some fancy art tablet. Naoum made every single aspect of The Master's Pupil old-school style before using a high-resolution film negative scanner to bring his beautiful artwork into the game's world.
https://www.tiktok.com/@patnaoumgames/video/7257654317488819458
But what's the game even like?
The Master's Pupil is a 12-level 2D sidescroller. It invites players to go on a puzzle-solving adventure that accompanies some of the most important moments in the life of Claude Monet, the 19th-century French impressionist painter whose works informed the game.
Don't let yourself get fooled by all the beauty, though. Great sadness lives underneath. To avoid spoilers, let's just say that players will have to suffer through the loss of someone very dear to Monet. They will also experience his fight against sight ailments that nearly took away his ability to create art in the way that he loved.
[caption id="attachment_394527" align="alignnone" width="1200"] Image by Pat Naoum[/caption]
At certain points in the game, the entire level will transform to reveal a Monet painting. The way that the various layers come together to form paintings feels reminiscent of Braid, but the art on display here is on a whole other level. Even if it doesn't seem like your kind of game, you should consider giving it a try. The Master's Pupil feels like one of those one-of-a-kind experiences that you soon won't forget.
The Master's Pupil is available on PC and Mac via Steam. It's also on the Nintendo Switch.
The post The Master’s Pupil is a hand-painted game that took seven years to make appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The Master’s Pupil is a hand-painted game that took seven years to make

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
I want to preface this Weekly Kusoge by saying that I absolutely love Tecmo’s Deception, but it is complete shit. I was inspired to try out the Deception series by community member Kerrik52. My only previous experience was watching a roommate try out 2005’s Trapt. However, upon looking at screenshots of Tecmo’s Deception, I fell in love.
Released in 1996, Tecmo’s Deception is just so PS1. While it established the foundation of the long-running series, it mostly failed spectacularly at everything it attempted. However, its King’s Field style first-person perspective and boxy, pixellated graphics just feel so cozy. A lot of what it failed to do was dropped by subsequent games in the series, which almost makes me feel like I won’t like them as much.
I will continue to send mixed signals throu…
articles.title: Tecmo’s Deception for PS1 is an unforgettable cluster of failures

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Speaking with the publication Transformer World, a Hasbro representative has revealed that Activision Blizzard currently doesn’t know the whereabouts of the source code for the various Transformers games that they were in charge of publishing.
It’s happened to the best of us. I’m not sure of the whereabouts of some of my dog’s puppy pictures, and I have a suspicion they were on a thumb drive that I formatted. However, while Zero is a good boy who deserves his life to be chronicled in as much detail as possible, I am not a multi-billion dollar corporation, and he is not a media production that cost millions of dollars and hours of human labor to produce. If I was and he was, I probably would have been a little more fastidious when it came to storing that data.
The representative explained, …
articles.title: Activision Blizzard has reportedly misplaced their Transformers titles
